argument.name: name
argument.description: The name of the color scheme. Currently, Alpha Anywhere only supports one color scheme named "Default".

argument.name: color_info
argument.description: The dot variable that receives the values of the custom colors. Color has the following sub-elements:

item.name: .colori.NAME
item.description: Name of the color "i", "I" can be between 1 and 32

item.name: .colori.color.red
item.description: Red component, A value 0-255. 0 is black, 255 is red.

item.name: .colori.color.green
item.description: green component, A value 0-255. 0 is black, 255 is green.

item.name: .colori.color.blue
item.description: blue component, A value 0-255. 0 is black, 255 is blue.

item.name: .colori.handle
item.description: internal color handle, Alpha Anywhere automatically assigns a value between 32 and 64. If color is new, assign a value of 0. Alpha Anywhere will automatically allocate a unique color handle for the entry.

page.description: Loads custom color definitions into variables.
page.discussion: The A5.LOAD_USER_COLORS() method populates a the Color dot variable with the values of the custom colors defined for the current database. Custom colors are defined using the View > Settings command.

section.description: The following script gets the custom color settings and stores them in a dot variable called Colors. The script then goes on to change the definition of color1.
section.example: 'Initialize Colors variable dim colors.color32 as P for i = 1 to 32 colors.colori.NAME = "" colors.colori.handle = 0 colors.colori.color.red = 0 colors.colori.color.green = 0 colors.colori.color.blue = 0 next :a5.load_user_colors("Default",colors) 'Change color 1 defition. colors.color1.name = "new red" colors.color1.color.red = 200 colors.color1.color.green = 20 colors.color1.color.blue = 20 'Save edited colors :a5.save_user_colors("Default",colors)
